0.title: ğŸ—ï¸ System Architecture
0.content: QualiDB is designed as a modular CLI application that bridges the gap between your raw database schema and Large Language Models (LLMs). | ğŸ§© High-Level Design | ğŸ”„ Data Flow . | 1. Documentation Generation | 2. Data Quality Checks | . | ğŸ› ï¸ Technology Stack | .

1.title: ğŸ§© High-Level Design
1.content: The tool consists of three main components: . | CLI Interface (Click): Handles user commands, menus, and configuration. | Database Engine (SQLAlchemy): Connects to BigQuery, Snowflake, or Postgres to fetch schemas and metadata. | AI Engine: Interacts with Claude, Gemini, or OpenAI to generate business-context descriptions. | . [Image of software architecture diagram] .

2.title: ğŸ”„ Data Flow
2.content: 1. Documentation Generation . When you run generate-schema, the data flows as follows: . | Extraction: The tool queries information_schema to get table and column names. | Prompting: It constructs a prompt: â€œWrite a 1-sentence description for column â€˜created_atâ€™ in table â€˜ordersâ€™â€¦â€ | AI Processing: The LLM returns a clean description (e.g., â€œTimestamp when the order was placed.â€). | Storage: The result is saved to a local models/schema.yml file for review. | . 2. Data Quality Checks . When you run check-quality: . | Introspection: The tool detects column types (e.g., finds all TIMESTAMP columns). | Query Generation: It builds SQL queries dynamically: SELECT MAX(ingested_at) FROM `project.dataset.table` . | Analysis: It compares the result against thresholds (e.g., > 24 hours old). | Reporting: Results are printed to the terminal in an ASCII table. | . Flow Diagram: . Flow Diagram: . flowchart TD %% Setup Phase subgraph Setup [1. Initialization] direction TB Start([Start]) --> CheckConn{Conn db String?} CheckConn -- No --> Prompt[Prompt User] CheckConn -- Yes --> Connect Connect --> FetchSchema[Select Schema & Tables] end %% Analysis Phase subgraph Analysis [2. Data Quality Loop] direction TB FetchSchema --> LoopT[Loop: Each Table] LoopT --> FetchCol[Fetch Columns] FetchCol --> LoopC[Loop: Each Column] LoopC --> CheckType{Check Type} CheckType -->|Freshness| Q1[Query: MAX Date] CheckType -->|Nulls| Q2[Query: Count NULLs] CheckType -->|Unique| Q3[Query: Count Distinct] Q1 --> Store[Store Result] Q2 --> Store Q3 --> Store Store --> LoopC LoopC -- Next Col --> LoopT end %% Reporting Phase subgraph Report [3. Output] direction TB LoopT -- Done --> Display[Print ASCII Table] Display --> End([End]) end %% Styles for a cleaner look classDef box fill:#f9f9f9,stroke:#333,stroke-width:1px; classDef decision fill:#e1f5fe,stroke:#01579b,stroke-width:2px; classDef term fill:#333,stroke:#333,color:#fff; class Setup,Analysis,Report box; class CheckConn,CheckType decision; class Start,End term; .

3.title: ğŸ› ï¸ Technology Stack
3.content: | Component | Library/Tool | Purpose | . | Language | Python 3.10+ | Core logic | . | CLI | click, questionary | Interactive menus and flags | . | Database | sqlalchemy | Unified interface for SQL DBs | . | AI | anthropic, openai | API wrappers for LLMs | . | Testing | pytest | Unit and integration testing | .

5.title: âš™ï¸ CLI Reference
5.content: QualiDB is designed for interactivity, but it also supports robust command-line flags. These options allow you to automate workflows, integrate with CI/CD pipelines, or simply bypass the interactive menus. | Global Options | The Checks . | ğŸ•’ Freshness | ğŸš« Null Values | ğŸ†” Uniqueness | . | Automatic Reporting | Commands . | 1. generate-schema | 2. check-quality | 3. push-to-db | . | .

6.title: Global Options
6.content: These flags can be used with any command to configure the runtime environment. | Flag | Description | Example | . | --conn | Connection String: Pass a SQLAlchemy connection string directly to bypass the interactive database selector. | bigquery://project_id:dataset_id | . | --help | Help: Show the help message and exit. | python db_check.py --help | .

7.title: The Checks
7.content: ğŸ•’ Freshness . | Logic: Automatically detects TIMESTAMP and DATE columns. Calculates the time difference between NOW() and the maximum value in that column. | Alert: Flags data older than 24 hours as âš ï¸ OLD. | . ğŸš« Null Values . | Logic: Scans columns for missing data (NULL). | Alert: Returns âŒ FAIL if any nulls are found in critical columns. | . ğŸ†” Uniqueness . | Logic: Checks Primary Keys or ID columns for duplicate entries. | Alert: Returns âŒ FAIL if COUNT(DISTINCT col) != COUNT(col). | .

8.title: Automatic Reporting
8.content: Results are displayed in a high-contrast ASCII table directly in your terminal, making it easy to spot failures at a glance.

9.title: Commands
9.content: 1. generate-schema . Description: Triggers the AI documentation workflow. It scans your schema and uses an LLM to generate business-friendly descriptions. Usage: . python db_check.py generate-schema [OPTIONS] --conn The database connection string (prompts if not provided). --output Path to output file. (Default: models/schema.yml) --model AI Model to use. (Default: gpt-3.5-turbo) --write-db Write descriptions directly to the database. (Flag) --help Show this message and exit. 2. check-quality . Description: Runs the automated data quality inspector. It checks for freshness, null values, and uniqueness constraints. Usage: . python db_check.py check-quality [OPTIONS] --conn The database connection string. (Env: DB_CONNECTION_STRING) --help Show this message and exit. 3. push-to-db . Description: Reads your local documentation file (schema.yml) and pushes the descriptions back to the database using COMMENT ON or ALTER TABLE statements. Usage: . python db_check.py push-to-db [OPTIONS] --input Path to the YAML file containing the descriptions. (Default: models/schema.yml) --conn The database connection string. (Env: DB_CONNECTION_STRING) --help Show this message and exit. Example: . python db_check.py push-to-db --conn "bigquery://project_id:dataset_id" .

11.title: ğŸš€ Getting Started with QualiDB
11.content: QualiDB is an all-in-one Data Governance assistant. It uses AI to document your database and automated checks to ensure data quality. | ğŸ› ï¸ Prerequisites | ğŸ“¥ Installation | AI Provider Keys (Only one is required) | Database Connection (Optional, can be passed via CLI) | .

12.title: ğŸ› ï¸ Prerequisites
12.content: Before running the tool, ensure you have: . | Python 3.10+ installed. | Access to a database (BigQuery, PostgreSQL, Snowflake, or SQLite). | An API Key for your preferred AI provider: . | ANTHROPIC_API_KEY (Claude - Recommended) | GOOGLE_API_KEY (Gemini) | OPENAI_API_KEY (GPT-4) | . | .

13.title: ğŸ“¥ Installation
13.content: . | Clone the repository: git clone [https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/QualiDB.git](https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/QualiDB.git) cd QualiDB . | Create a virtual environment: python -m venv .venv source .venv/bin/activate # On Windows: .venv\Scripts\activate . | Install dependencies: pip install -r requirements.txt . | Configure Environment Variables: Create a .env file in the root directory and add your keys: ```bash

14.title: AI Provider Keys (Only one is required)

15.title: Database Connection (Optional, can be passed via CLI)

17.title: ğŸš€ QualiDB AI
17.content: Your AI-powered Data Governance Assistant. QualiDB is a CLI tool that automates database documentation using LLMs (Claude, Gemini, GPT) and runs automated data quality checks (Freshness, Nulls, Uniqueness). Get Started View Source .

18.title: ğŸ”¥ Key Features
18.content: . | ğŸ§  AI Documentation: Auto-generate business descriptions for tables and columns using Claude 3.5 Sonnet or Gemini. | ğŸ” Data Quality Inspector: Run instant checks for Nulls, Duplicates, and Freshness. | ğŸ’¾ Database Sync: Push approved documentation back into your database (BigQuery, Snowflake, Postgres) as comments. | ğŸ›¡ï¸ BigQuery Native: Smart handling of project.dataset.table schemas and strict quoting. | .

24.title: ğŸ“„ Sample Output
24.content: See examples of what QualiDB generates for your project. | 1. Generated Documentation (schema.yml) | .

25.title: 1. Generated Documentation (schema.yml)
25.content: When you run the Generate Documentation command, QualiDB uses AI to write descriptions and saves them to models/schema.yml.
